quest.name: Eight-armed and Dangerous
journal: Ellie has the latest information on the phantom thief's target.

Inspector's Log:
With my plan to out the thief at Miss Arabella's wedding proving a rousing success, we were this close to defending the treasure from the clutches of the many-faced fiend. But even the best-laid plans of inspectors extraordinaire are wont to go awry, and our phantom quarry successfully absconded with the so-called Maiden's Virtue. With no rest for the weary agent of enquiry, I have ventured to the Coliseum to begin my preliminary search of the environs. This time, I swear on the Manderville name, the phantom thief shall meet his match!
　　　　　　　　　　　　*　*　*
Ellie believes she has identified the thief's next target: a priceless treasure set to be awarded to the winner of the Mythril Cup, a tournament scheduled to be held at the Coliseum in the coming days. She informs you that her colleague Ganelon is in Ul'dah as you speak, researching for a feature on this very event. Travel to town and see what the reporter might tell you.

With some encouragement from Ellie, Ganelon shares his findings with you. It would seem that many of the scheduled combatants for the Mythril Cup have withdrawn due to injuries sustained under curious circumstances, leading to suspicions of foul play. Speak with the gatekeeper Yuyubaya to gain entrance to the Coliseum, that you might further question the relevant parties.

Upon arriving at the Coliseum and speaking with the organizer, one Dour Meadow, you soon reunite with a certain gentleman inspector and consulting detective, with the rivalry between the two as heated as ever. With a mind to keep the prizes out of the hands of the thief, you enter the tourney at Inspector Briardien's behest, submitting your application to the tentacled receptionist known by the name of Ultros. Fearing for your safety now that you have declared your intention to fight, Ellie suggests that you return to Ganelon and seek out more information on the shady attacks against potential combatants.

Ganelon shares with you his suspicions that the confident gladiatrix by the name of Avila might be in some way connected to the curious incidents. He encourages you to seek out one Raging Rat, a gladiator who fell to the selfsame Avila in the preliminary rounds, that you might gain the information you need to protect yourself.

Raging Rat suspects that Avila's renowned “Tempest Blade” is some sort of sorcery, while Ellie wonders if the Ala Mhigan shieldmaiden might not be being aided by one of her fellow refugees. Meanwhile, Hildibrand and Nashu have taken a harmless, if seemingly unfruitful, interest in a certain eight-legged individual. Humor him by traveling to the Coliseum and seeing where his investigation might have led.

Alongside Hildibrand, you pursue the shifty Ultros about and around the Coliseum. As expected, his behavior is most curious, if not particularly enlightening. Return to the Coliseum entrance and listen to Nashu's latest musings on the movements of her quarry.

Your pursuit of Ultros has proven to be every bit as fruitful as expected─which is to say, not very. Perhaps Inspector Hildibrand has managed to glean something from this utterly unremarkable turn of events. Inquire with him as to what may be on his mind.
objectives: Speak with Yuyubaya in the Coliseum.
Speak with Ganelon in front of the Coliseum.
Speak with Hildibrand in the Coliseum.
Speak with Nashu Mhakaracca in front of the Coliseum.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Forename! I was wondering when you'd show up. I've got the latest scoop on the “victor's spoils” that our many-faced friend has set his sights on.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Have you visited the Coliseum of late? There's a tourney in the works, and it's looking to be a big one─the Mythril Cup, sponsored by none other than Amajina & Sons Mineral Concern.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: They say that Master Fyrgeiss will be furnishing the prizes himself from his personal collection. Small wonder it's captured the attention of Mister Stickyfingers.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: You are familiar with the Concern, yes? It's only the largest mining interest in the sultanate, after all.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The chairman, Master Fyrgeiss, sits on the Syndicate, and possesses such wealth that rumor has it he could buy half the realm if he chose to.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: He's also renowned for being something of a martial arts enthusiast. With his position affording him little opportunity to test his own skills, he settles for living vicariously through the exploits of others─hence his sponsorship of tournaments like the Mythril Cup.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: My colleague Ganelon is in Ul'dah covering the tourney as we speak. If we were to track him down, I bet he'd be able to give us something to get our investigation started.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Let's make for Ul'dah, find Ganelon, and get this investigation started!

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: Yes? I'm a busy man. If you're looking for small talk, I suggest you look elsewhere.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: No need to be rude, Ganelon─she'she's a friend of mine. Now, what say you share your latest findings with us? I promise I'll make it worth your while.

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: E-Ellie!? Hmph. If it isn't the Mythril Eye's star reporter. Come to have a laugh at Ganelon's expense before returning to pen your latest front-page feature, eh?

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: <sigh> Oh, very well. Just promise you'll put in a good word for me with the higher-ups, okay? Now, let me tell you this: there's strange things afoot at the Coliseum.

dialogue.name: HOTCH
dialogue.text: (-???-)Bugger all! It's a travesty, I tell you!

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: Hotch, Hewe, and Haymo! Whatever is the matter? And where, pray tell, is Hutchin? The four of you will compete for the Cup together, yes?

dialogue.name: HEWE
dialogue.text: I fear that an unfortunate mishap has left Hutchin in no condition to fight. We were just on our way to convey the dire news to Dour Meadow.

dialogue.name: HOTCH
dialogue.text: Mishap, my arse─this was sabotage! Some bloody coward out there will stop at nothing to eliminate his competition. I swear it on my subligar!

dialogue.name: HUTCHIN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Lower your voice, Hotch. My head stings enough without your bloody shouting.

dialogue.name: HAYMO
dialogue.text: H-Hutchin! Sh-Should you not be resting your wounds? Oh, but forgive your incompetent, unworthy comrade! If I had been quicker with my mantra, we would still be four men strong!

dialogue.name: HUTCHIN
dialogue.text: Do not berate yourself so, Haymo. In victory and in defeat, the Mantravilles fight as one. You bear no more responsibility for my wounds than I.

dialogue.name: HUTCHIN
dialogue.text: Anyroad, I daresay I'll not be getting back into fighting fettle by arsing about in bed. I'm ready to chant some mantras─how about the lot of you!?

dialogue.name: HAYMO
dialogue.text: H-Hutchin! For you, I am always ready!

dialogue.name: HUTCHIN
dialogue.text: Now that's what I like to hear! A thousand mantras, and I want each one to ring out over the Sagolii!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The...Mantravilles!?

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: Aye. As Hutchin tells it, they took their name from a training partner they met at the Fist of Rhalgr─a man they most admired for his devotion and chiseled physique.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...Consider me not the least bit interested. This talk of attacks on the competitors, however─of this I would hear more.

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. I mentioned that strange things were afoot, yes? With mere days left before the Mythril Cup, a staggering number of would-be combatants have withdrawn, citing a host of curious ailments and injuries.

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: With the list of entrants shrinking by the day, the organizers have been forced to abandon the elimination format in favor of a mass melee between what few battlers remain.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The phantom thief's challenge... Gladiators dropping like flies... No, this is no mere coincidence. I would speak to the individual in charge of the event. Where might I find him?

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: Though the Concern sponsors the tourney, the day-to-day organizational duties are being handled by a fellow by the name of Dour Meadow. He should be in his office within the Coliseum's halls. I'll send word to the gateman, Yuyubaya─he owes the Mythril Eye a favor or two.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Splendid! Come, Forename, we've got a case to crack!

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: With gladiators dropping one after the next, I've had to rewrite my Mythril Cup preview five times in the past two days. Ah, make that six...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Let's go find this Dour Meadow and see what he can tell us about the tourney. Ganelon said we could find him in his office at the Coliseum, yes?

dialogue.name: YUYUBAYA
dialogue.text: From the Mythril Eye, you say? Then by all means, you are free to enter!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I am Ellie, reporter for the Mythril Eye─never blinking, all-seeing, you know the deal, yes? And you must be Dour Meadow. I was hoping I could ask you a few questions about the upcoming tourney.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Gar har har! Who am I to argue with free publicity? And from a charmin' little thing like yerself. Ask away, me girl!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: That said, between the challenge from that so-called phantom thief and now these bizarre attacks targeting the fighters, our tourney's already the talk o' the town! Not that you'll see me complainin'─provided someone's still left to fight, that is.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Yer free to investigate as ye wish, but ye'd be smart to exercise some caution. Needless to say, recent events have everyone here a bit on edge. Why, just moments ago one fighter almost took off another's head for insultin' the color o' his subli─

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Looks like we've got ourselves another...hm? These two aren't in the entry books...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: ...And our challenger unleashes a vicious right hook as the gentleman inspector was channeling his strength for his next attack. Ladies and gentlemen, we have a winner!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I-Inspector Briardien! As efficient as ever, I see.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: A true gentleman...<cough>...eschews violence...<cough>...Inspector.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...You were thinking. It annoyed me.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Dour Meadow, I presume. Tell me everything you can about the prizes for this tourney. And try to be brief.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Was wonderin' when ye might ask. Master Fyrgeiss has spared no expense in making the Mythril Cup the most lucrative tourney this Coliseum's ever seen. The victor will receive a true treasure from his collection─the Warden's Grace, a ring fitted with the largest sun sphere ye'll find outside o' Qarn.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: The second- and third-place prizes are nothin' to sneeze at, neither. But I don't care how many faces he's got─we've nothin' to fear from this thief. The Concern has hired an elite regiment of Stone Torches to watch over the vault day an' night.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Yes, just as the Brass Blades were so successful in stopping the thief last time. If you want your treasures safe, go fetch them and bring them to me. And be quick about it─I haven't all day.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Fear I can't do that, Inspector. After all, what proof do I have that you ain't mister many-faces in another of his elaborate getups?

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: No, if you want to get your hands on the spoils, you'll have to claim them as any other would─in battle.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, what with the ranks thinned as they are, we're actively recruiting new competitors. The more, the merrier─and the more lucrative, at that. Gar har har!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Now, where did our receptionist get off to? Over here, ye slimy bugger! We've got some fresh blood for the melee!

dialogue.name: ORTHRUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Give me a moment, will ya? I've only got eight arms! ...Or were they legs?

dialogue.name: ORTHRUS
dialogue.text: (-Slobbering Cephalopod-)Ya called? I was just about to give the lovely Miss Avila the grand tour!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I-Inspector Hildibrand, look! He's...purple!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Astute as ever, Nashu! This color, this overabundance of appendages...I smell a case!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Ah, that's just my receptionist, Ultros. Don't be startled, now─he's an ugly little bugger, but he's friendly enough. Word has it he was one of many bizarre creatures born from a recent experiment with ancient incantations at the Thaumaturges' Guild.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: They were going to seal him away in a hole in the desert with the others, when he opened his slobberin' mouth and started pleadin' for his life. “I just want to live in peace! I'll do anything! Anything!” So the management hired him to perform odd jobs about the Coliseum.

dialogue.name: ORTHRUS
dialogue.text: And am I ever glad they did! I tell ya, this job ain't glamorous, but it sure has its perks.

dialogue.name: ORTHRUS
dialogue.text: What a delicious morsel! I wanna get my tentacles around her...

dialogue.name: AVILA
dialogue.text: Hmph. I know not who you are or where you hail from, and I do not care. If you dare challenge me, my Tempest Blade will show you no mercy.

dialogue.name: AVILA
dialogue.text: You can forget about your case, Inspector. There is only one who will claim the victor's spoils, and that is me.

dialogue.name: ORTHRUS
dialogue.text: Ooh, I just loooooove it when she talks tough. Now, who's the chump who wanted to get a pummeling by my lovely little Avi?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Though a gentleman takes far more pride in rescuing fair damsels than fighting them, I fear we have little recourse. I, Hildibrand─agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire─shall do what must be done to...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Forename Surname will be entering the tournament on my behalf.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Forename Surname? Ye do look like a Surname... Well, bugger me with a spear! To think I'd see the day when a Warrior o' Light stood in my Coliseum!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Hear that clink-clink-clinkin'? That's the sound o' gil pourin' into our coffers when the public finds out that a true Eorzean hero will be steppin' into the ring to fight for the Mythril Cup! Oh, and I reckon yer friend can tag along, too. Show 'em where to sign, Ulty!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: With Forename, I suppose we have as good a chance as any. Now we just need to make sure that shehe doesn't come down with some curious injury.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: That gladiatrix─Avila, was it?─seemed quite certain of her chances at victory. Suspiciously certain, I would say.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Haha! I am already ten steps ahead of you, Inspector! That Ultros fellow seemed most knowledgeable about Miss Avila. Come, Nashu─the investigation is afoot!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: As much as that sounds like an amazingly productive line of investigation, might I suggest that our first priority is to keep Forename here safe. Let us return to Ganelon and see what else he can tell us of these mysterious attacks on the combatants.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Very well. I shall leave that task to you. I have a lead of my own to investigate. Should you uncover any new information, I trust you will share it with me at first opportunity.

dialogue.name: YUYUBAYA
dialogue.text: You must have nerves of solid steel to enter this tourney with all the ill rumors floating about. Do watch your back, will you?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I suppose that our questioning of Mister Ultros can wait. Let us see if this Ganelon fellow can enlighten us!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Look, I know you're the Warrior of Light and all, but we can't afford to take any chances. Be on your guard, Forename.

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: You again? I've already told you that─ What? Entered the tourney, you say? Are you out of your bleeding mind!?

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: ...Look. I've got a suspicion or two, which I'm happy to share with you. But in the end, you have to protect yourself, you hear?

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: So I've been asking around, and it seems that more than a few of the fighters who pulled out of the tourney were scheduled to fight a warrioress by the name of Avila.

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: Now, I can't make any promises, but my instincts tell me this girl is bad news. But don't take it from me when you can hear it from someone who crossed blades with her just days ago.

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: ...Fellow by the name of Raging Rat. Had the misfortune of being matched up with Avila in the preliminary round, and earned himself a right bruising from it all. Last I heard, he was resting up back at the Pugilists' Guild. Why don't you pay him a visit?

dialogue.name: GANELON
dialogue.text: A fellow by the name of Raging Rat had the misfortune of being matched up with Avila in the preliminary round, and earned himself a proper bruising from it all. Last I heard, he was resting up back at the Pugilists' Guild. Why don't you pay him a visit?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oho, the plot ever thickens! While I have my doubts that the lovely Avila is behind these dastardly incidents, it would behoove us to hear what this Raging Rat fellow has to say.

dialogue.name: RAZINGRAT
dialogue.text: Come to have a good laugh at ol' Raging Rat's expense, 'ave ye? Well, yer not the first. I say, is there not a man in this entire realm with an onze of sympathy!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Greetings, good sir! How fortunate you are today that your guest is Hildibrand Manderville, gentleman and inspector. Now, if you would, please enlighten me to how exactly it was that you were beaten to a bloody pulp by Miss Avila!

dialogue.name: RAZINGRAT
dialogue.text: Gentleman my arse! Have ye not a whit o' delicacy!?

dialogue.name: RAZINGRAT
dialogue.text: ...Never ye mind. Look, the records may say I lost, but I'll admit to nothin' o' the sort. I'll shout it at the top o' my lungs if no one else will. The girl doesn't fight fair.

dialogue.name: RAZINGRAT
dialogue.text: Tempest Blade!? Some kind o' foul sorcery, if you ask me. Mark my words: that girl is up to no good. If she weren't so damned easy on the eyes, she'd be rottin' in gaol as we speak.

dialogue.name: RAZINGRAT
dialogue.text: The girl's Ala Mhigan, or haven't ye heard? You know how it is with those refugees. Why fight with honor when ye've got nothin' to lose?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Yes, and why not disparage an entire people in a pathetic attempt to salvage your sorry pride? This one's a real piece of work, Forename. Let's be on our way.

dialogue.name: RAZINGRAT
dialogue.text: ...I didn't mean no offense, miss. Just tellin' it like it is, as it were.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Perhaps it truly is some manner of sorcery, as the fellow says. Or perhaps she works with an accomplice?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: She didn't strike me as the magic-wielding type. If I were a betting woman, I'd put my gil on the latter.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ah, Miss Ellie! The thrill of the chase has struck a chord with you, as well! Yes, I can see it in the wrinkles beneath your eyes! We might very well make an inspectress of you yet!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I'll give you a good wrinkle, you insensitive boor! ...Ahem. If what the man says is true, it's likely that her fellow Ala Mhigans might sympathize with her plight. An accomplice would hardly be out of the question.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: ...Yes, I can see it now! Two unfortunate souls, shunned by those around them, united by destiny and a common desire for justice!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ample appendages whirling wildly, sending gusts of wind flying every which way! Avila and Ulty─a match made in the heavens! Were it any more obvious, I could have solved this case without leaving my home!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Incredible! Your powers of deduction never fail to amaze, Inspector!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: What is it with you two and that infernal octopus!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Mister Ultros should still be at the Coliseum. Let us hurry before he slithers back off to whencesoever he came!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Shhh, friend, and look over yonder!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Behold those exquisite legs! Those stylish tentacles! The unearthly undulations of his squirmy, squishy body! Yes, our friend Ulty is a most fascinating creature indeed.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Behold how he carefully eyes the gladiatrix before him. What manner of mischief is he plotting!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: He speaks! Yes, this is most suspicious indeed!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oho, what is this? The girl has fled in a panic!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Our friend Ulty appears to be discouraged. Look at the way his shoulders sag! ...Or how they would sag, if he had shoulders.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Our quarry is on the move! Quickly, Nashu─we must pursue!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Aha, there he is! You will not escape us so easily, Mister Ultros!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Mister Ulty seems to have found himself another gladiatrix. What might he be plotting this time?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Look at those succulent legs! I reckon they'd taste just wonderful in a good marinara sauce!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Mmm...marinara sauce... Ah, he speaks!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: ...And another girl rushes off. Whatever did he say to her?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: ...He looks so sad! Shall we douse him in lemon butter and put him out of his misery, Inspector? Whatever is he doing with these girls, anyway?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Call me crazy, but I think he...likes them?
